content.webTitle: Harry Kane on target to continue England Under-21s’ dominance

fields.headline: Harry Kane on target to continue England Under-21s’ dominance
fields.bodyText: Harry Kane rewarded England Under-21s’ patience by coming off the bench to score the only goal of the game for Gareth Southgate’s side and continue their impressive European Championship qualification campaign with victory in Lithuania. The Tottenham striker headed in with nine minutes left, giving England their eighth win from nine matches in a group they had long since won. With James Ward-Prowse and Tom Carroll marshalling the midfield, England created numerous chances in Kaunas but profligacy in front of goal threatened to leave Southgate frustrated. Saido Berahino’s early effort was tipped over and Ward-Prowse fired past the post before Nathaniel Chalobah had to clear the danger after Lukas Baranauskas’s bobbling shot beat the England goalkeeper, Jack Butland. After the interval Berahino was again denied and both Nathan Redmond and Tom Ince came close to breaking the deadlock – the former seeing his effort cleared off the line. But Kane, whose introduction sharpened the visitors’ attack, leapt to meet Ward-Prowse’s cross and crash his header past Tomas Svedkauskas in the Lithuania goal to seal victory.
